title: [bug] can not load custom protocol content when creating window

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

```rust
let app_store = WindowBuilder::new(
    &app,
    "appstore",
    WindowUrl::External("package://localhost/".parse().unwrap()),
).build().unwrap();
```

after looking inside the tauri source code, found the problem.

https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/e4292ce7be198f6265dde9b6ae54e73b7c41e7da/core/tauri/src/manager.rs#L1128-L1138

is that ok to support something likes `WindowUrl::CustomProtocol("package://localhost/".parse().unwrap())` and treats as local content or adding a config to remove the limitation by the user's will?

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

App
